subSections.title: Introduction
subSections.content:
- Eerie mists surround Barovia, trapping its inhabitants.
- This chapter prepares you for the adventurers' journey into the mists.
- Outlines Strahd's history and goals.
- 'Fortunes of Ravenloft' walks you through the tarokka card reading.
- Adventure hooks help draw characters into the horror of Barovia.

subSections.title: Strahd von Zarovich
subSections.content:
- Strahd von Zarovich is a vampire and wizard.
- His statistics are in Appendix D.
- He can be encountered almost anywhere in his domain.
- Strahd appears in a specific place indicated by the card reading, unless forced into his tomb.

subSections.title: Early Life
subSections.content:
- Strahd was a count, prince, soldier, and conqueror.
- After King Barov's death, Strahd waged bloody wars against his enemies.
- He named the valley 'Barovia' after his father.
- Strahd settled there due to the valley's beauty.

subSections.title: Relationship with Queen Ravenovia and Sergei
subSections.content:
- Queen Ravenovia feared Strahd after Barov's death.
- She kept Sergei away from battle.
- Strahd envied the love given to Sergei.
- Peace made Strahd restless.
- Strahd forged a pact with the Dark Powers for immortality.

subSections.title: Castle Ravenloft
subSections.content:
- Strahd brought wizards and artisans to Barovia.
- Built Castle Ravenloft to rival ancestral fortresses.
- Named it after his mother, Ravenovia.
- Ravenovia died on her way to Barovia; her body was sealed in a crypt beneath the castle.

subSections.title: Tatyana and Sergei
subSections.content:
- Strahd loved Tatyana, a beautiful Barovian woman.
- Tatyana fell in love with Sergei.
- On their wedding day, Strahd killed Sergei and drank his blood.
- Tatyana jumped to her death to escape Strahd.
- Castle guards shot Strahd, but he survived.

subSections.title: Transformation into a Vampire
subSections.content:
- The Dark Powers honored Strahd's pact.
- Strahd became a vampire, slaughtered the guards.
- Faces of his parents appeared in thunderclouds, judging him.
- The valley and castle were locked in a demiplane with deadly fog.

subSections.title: Life as a Vampire
subSections.content:
- Strahd has ruled Ravenloft for centuries.
- He took several consorts, all turned into vampire spawn.
- Strangers are sometimes brought to his domain for his amusement.
- Strahd enjoys their resistance as a diversion.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Belief in Escape
subSections.content:
- Strahd believes escape lies in finding a worthy successor.
- His arrogance prevents anyone from being good enough.
- Only a great von Zarovich could sway the Dark Powers.

'I am the Ancient. I am the Land.'

'My beginnings are lost in darkness. I am undead, forever.'

—Tome of Strahd

subSections.title: Turn Ireena Kolyana
subSections.content:
- Strahd believes Ireena is Tatyana reincarnated.
- He wants to claim Ireena as his consort.
- Strahd visited Ireena twice and drank her blood.
- He plans to kill Ireena and turn her into his vampire spawn.

subSections.title: Find Rudolph van Richten
subSections.content:
- Strahd is aware of vampire hunter Rudolph van Richten.
- He has spies searching for van Richten.
- Strahd wants to imprison van Richten and break his spirit.

subSections.title: Search for a Successor or Consort
subSections.content:
- Strahd senses new blood and assesses newcomers.
- He looks for a successor or consort among them.
- Charismatic and arrogant adventurers draw his attention.
- Strahd tests their fortitude, focusing attacks on them.
- If none prove worthy, they serve as his amusement.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Emotional State
subSections.content:
- Strahd feels no pity, remorse, love, or hate.
- He believes he is the master of his own fate.
- Barely any emotion remains in him.
- Tatyana's death haunts him, but he has no regret.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Nature as a Conqueror
subSections.content:
- In undeath, Strahd conquers people, not realms.
- He corrupts good souls and destroys those who resist.
- Characters who appeal to his humanity will fail.
- Strahd claims Tatyana's soul belongs to him.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Manipulative Behavior
subSections.content:
- Strahd can be seductive and subtle.
- Attractive or clever individuals amuse him for a time.
- He exploits weaknesses and tries to create divisions.
- He may promise to turn someone into a full vampire.
- Ultimately, Strahd betrays and controls them as vampire spawn.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Movement in Barovia
subSections.content:
- Strahd moves freely in his realm and castle.
- The more he encounters characters, the better.
- Multiple encounters before the final showdown are likely.
- Combat details are in Appendix D.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Encounters with the Characters
subSections.content:
- Strahd visits to terrorize characters, day or night.
- He tries to charm or goad them into inviting him inside.
- Strahd never attacks Ireena.
- Encounters are meant to test, not kill, the characters.
- Strahd and his minions withdraw after a few rounds.

subSections.title: Tarokka Card Reading
subSections.content:
- Events are based on twists of fate discerned by tarokka cards.
- Draw cards to determine: 
  - Strahd’s location in Castle Ravenloft
  - Locations of three important treasures
  - The identity of a powerful ally
- Each card reading can change the adventure.

subSections.title: Madam Eva’s Reading
subSections.content:
- Characters may meet Madam Eva for a card reading.
- Ezmerelda d’Avenir can also perform a card reading.
- Ezmerelda’s deck is hidden in her wagon (Chapter 11, Area V1).

subSections.title: Appendix E: Tarokka Deck
subSections.content:
- Appendix E summarizes all cards of the tarokka deck.
- It includes their symbolic meanings.

subSections.title: Introduction
subSections.content:
- Barovia was once an idyllic valley nestled in the Balinok Mountains.
- Strahd led a bloody crusade, conquering Barovia and claiming it as his home.
- The valley is now a demiplane formed by Strahd's consciousness, surrounded by deadly fog.

subSections.title: Strahd’s Rule and the Fog
subSections.content:
- Barovia is no longer part of the Material Plane.
- No creature can leave without Strahd's permission.
- The fog disorients and traps those attempting to leave.

subSections.title: Strahd and the Vistani
subSections.content:
- Strahd allows the Vistani to come and go freely.
- He respects their lifestyle and owes them for saving his life.
- The Vistani claim to possess potions to exit the fog, but these are false concoctions.

subSections.title: Life Under Strahd
subSections.content:
- Native Barovians have been terrorized by Strahd for centuries.
- They live in three main settlements: the villages of Barovia and Krezk, and the town of Vallaki.
- The Keepers of the Feather, a secret society of wereravens, assist those who oppose Strahd.

subSections.title: Natural Features
subSections.content:
- Thunderclouds cast a gray pall over Barovia.
- The valley is enclosed by Mount Baratok and Mount Ghakis.
- Lake Zarovich lies between the mountains, with Vallaki at its southern shore.

subSections.title: Settlements
subSections.content:
- Vallaki: A town enclosed by a palisade, known for its festivals.
- Krezk: A walled village around the Abbey of Saint Markovia.
- Village of Barovia: Lies east of the mountains, watched over by Castle Ravenloft.

subSections.title: Castle Ravenloft
subSections.content:
- Castle Ravenloft stands on a high column of rock known as the Pillarstone of Ravenloft.
- It looms over the village of Barovia.

subSections.title: Mists of Ravenloft
subSections.content:
- Deadly fog surrounds Barovia, preventing escape.
- Creatures in the fog must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or gain exhaustion.
- The fog turns travelers around, eventually returning them to Barovia.

subSections.title: Sunlight in Barovia
subSections.content:
- The sun never fully shines in Barovia.
- Even daylight is muted and not considered sunlight for certain effects.
- Strahd and his vampire spawn stay indoors during the day but fear magical sunlight.

subSections.title: Alterations to Magic
subSections.content:
- Barovia is isolated from other planes; spells like teleport and plane shift fail.
- Magic that allows contact with other planes works normally, but Strahd can make himself the recipient.
- Magic involving extradimensional space works, but plane-specific restrictions apply.

subSections.title: Cosmetic Spell Modifications
subSections.content:
- Certain spells are modified to reflect Barovia's horror:
  - Alarm: Triggers a scream instead of a ping.
  - Find familiar: The familiar appears undead.
  - Mage hand: The conjured hand appears skeletal.

subSections.title: Barovian Attitudes
subSections.content:
- Barovians are wary of strangers and stick to tradition.
- They are silent and disapproving of anything unfamiliar.
- Barovians are resilient but have been shaped by fear of Strahd.

subSections.title: Children and Adults
subSections.content:
- Barovian children are raised in fear, taught to avoid the woods.
- Adults live simple lives, hiding their valuables to avoid attention from Strahd.

subSections.title: Souls and Shells
subSections.content:
- Only about 1 in 10 Barovians have souls.
- Soulless Barovians are empty, compliant, and lack charm.
- Souls reincarnate, sometimes resulting in identical appearances across generations.

subSections.title: Barovian Names
subSections.content:
- Male Names: Alek, Boris, Dragomir, Ivan, Stefan, Vladislav.
- Female Names: Alana, Dorina, Ivana, Katerina, Sorina, Valentina.
- Family Names: Antonovich, Dargovich, Martikov, Ulrich, Zalenski.

subSections.title: Introduction
subSections.content:
- The village of Barovia lies in the shadow of Castle Ravenloft.
- Residents are terrified of Strahd and rarely leave their homes.
- Strahd pays nightly visits to Ireena Kolyana, believing her to be Tatyana reincarnated.
- He plans to turn Ireena into his bride and imprison her in the castle crypts.

subSections.title: Approaching the Village
subSections.content:
- Dense fog surrounds everything as characters approach.
- The village lies eerily silent except for a distant sobbing sound.
- Sobbing comes from Mad Mary’s townhouse (area E3).
- Most shops are permanently closed and looted, with claw marks on walls.

subSections.title: Random Occupants
subSections.content:
- Roll a d20 to determine house occupants:
  - 1-3: No occupants.
  - 4-8: 2d4 swarms of rats.
  - 9-16: Barovian villagers.
  - 17-20: 2d4 Strahd zombies.

subSections.title: Rats
subSections.content:
- Houses infested with rats look abandoned.
- The rats serve Strahd and attack if the characters enter.

subSections.title: Barovian Villagers
subSections.content:
- Houses have 1d4 adults and 1d8-1 children.
- Villagers are terrified, avoid strangers, and flee danger.
- At night, they cower with makeshift holy symbols.

subSections.title: Strahd Zombies
subSections.content:
- Infested houses reek of death.
- Zombies attack characters who enter.

subSections.title: E1. Bildrath’s Mercantile
subSections.content:
- A mercantile owned by Bildrath Cantemir, selling adventuring gear at ten times the listed price.
- Bildrath never bargains, saying, 'If you want it badly enough, you’ll pay for it.'
- His nephew, Parriwimple, acts as muscle when needed.

subSections.title: E2. Blood of the Vine Tavern
subSections.content:
- The tavern is owned by three Vistani women: Alenka, Mirabel, and Sorvia.
- Ismark Kolyanovich (son of the burgomaster) is often found here.
- Ismark seeks help to protect his sister, Ireena, from Strahd.

subSections.title: E3. Mad Mary’s Townhouse
subSections.content:
- Mary sits in sorrow, clutching a malformed doll.
- Her daughter, Gertruda, ran away a week ago, and Mary fears the worst.

subSections.title: E4. Burgomaster’s Mansion
subSections.content:
- The mansion is worn, with claw marks and blackened walls from attacks.
- Ireena Kolyana is inside, refusing to leave until her father is buried.
- The body of Kolyan Indirovich lies in a simple wooden coffin.

subSections.title: E5. Church
subSections.content:
- A worn and weary church standing against the roots of the Pillarstone of Ravenloft.
- The priest, Donavich, prays constantly for his son Doru, a vampire spawn trapped in the undercroft.
- Characters can assist with the burial of the burgomaster.

subSections.title: E6. Cemetery
subSections.content:
- Enclosed by a rusty iron fence.
- Every night, spirits rise from the graves and march toward Castle Ravenloft.

subSections.title: E7. Haunted House
subSections.content: - The haunted house is detailed in Appendix B, 'Death House.'

subSections.title: March of the Dead
subSections.content:
- Every night at midnight, one hundred spirits rise from the cemetery and march to Castle Ravenloft.
- These spirits are former adventurers who failed to defeat Strahd.

subSections.title: Dream Pastries
subSections.content:
- Morgantha, a night hag, sells 'dream pastries' to villagers.
- She collects payment in gold or occasionally takes a child as payment.
- Characters can intervene to rescue a child if they wish.
